Physician Assistants and Advanced Practice Nursing Providers
Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB

observation.value: (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB

td.content: s:female artist aged 57 yrs presents via EMS a short time following MVA. she was struck while passing through intersection, and sustained injury to the front of the head (LOC 47 min). Striking vehicle traveling at estimated 30 mph on impact. pt c/o severe headache, moderate nausea, mild vomiting and Traumatic Injury - Blunt. o:Height 59 in, Weight 174 lbs, Temperature 98.1 F, Pulse 83, SystolicBP 109, DiastolicBP 66, Respiration 16, CT Head (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB, MRI Brain Unremarkable, appears in NAD, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Chest = normal breathing sounds B/L, Neuro: WNL, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex a:TBI (concussion) p:administered Acetaminophen - 650 mg po/pr q 6 hrs PRN pain, performed CT Head, MRI Brain, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and ordered rest, and referred patient to family practice/primary care.

td.content: s:female artist aged 57 years presents for one (1) week f/u after sustaining a mild concussion (LOC 47 min). she denies vomiting, nausea and headache since the accident. she has had no subsequent loss of consciousness (LOC). she has resumed usual state of function. o:Height 59 in, Weight 175 lbs, Temperature 98.2 F, Pulse 84, SystolicBP 110, DiastolicBP 68, Respiration 17, ImPACT test Verbal Memory=98,Visual Memory=97,Processing Speed=46.1,Reaction Time=0.47, HEENT: NCAT, PERRL, Neck: Supple, C/V: RRR, Pulm: CTAB. Good effort, Abd: Scaphoid, soft, ND, NTTP. BS WNL, MS: Extremities x 4 WNL. Strength 5/5, equal bilaterally, Neuro: CN II-XII WNL. No deficits, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex a:S/P Concussion (with loss of consciousness from 31 to 59 minutes). No sequelae p:performed ImPACT test, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed.

Term.SOAP_SECTION: head, eyes, ears, nose, throat Examination

content2.Unmatched: No deficits , Eyes = normal pupillary reflex
